image.altText: A farmer in a navy blue jumper leaning on a post, with cattle feeding on hay in a paddock behind him

props.synopsis: South Australia's Limestone Coast is home to lush terrain in Australia's driest state, but its groundwater supplies are slowly in decline.

title.children: This region is a food bowl and forestry powerhouse, but the alarm is ringing over its water supply

image.altText: Women and children prepare Indian bread in a kitchen

props.synopsis: Nearly 2,000 people visit the Riverland town of Berri for the region's first Punjabi sport and culture festival, which organisers hope to make a major event.

title.children: Food and sport bring thousands together to celebrate at Punjabi festival

image.altText: A white fire truck emblazoned with red and yellow checkered tape and bearing the words Cummins, CFS and Rescue

props.synopsis: A Port Lincoln man has died in a light plane crash in fields at Yeelanna, north of Cummins, on the Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: Pilot dies in light plane crash on SA's Eyre Peninsula

image.altText: Sheep having a feed. Drone photo taken from above.

props.synopsis: The nation's drought supports will come under scrutiny at a major national forum today as southern farmers continue to battle dry times.

title.children: Farmers call for low-interest loans as cash flow dries up in drought

image.altText: A police security office in a navy uniform walks down a road to a large school building

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old was charged in May over alleged threats to use explosives and poisons to target a school and public events in Adelaide.

title.children: Charges dropped against teen accused of threatening staff and students at Adelaide high school

image.altText: A man with beard smiling in a laboratory with measuring instruments on a table

props.synopsis: They're called '"forever chemicals" because of their extreme durability, but Adelaide researchers say they have developed a new method to combat PFAS.

title.children: Researchers develop new material to help combat 'forever chemicals'

image.altText: a young man in blue and yellow american football gear in a professional photo

props.synopsis: Growing up in South Australia's Riverland, Jake Stoeckel never imagined one day he would be playing college football for the Kent State Golden Flashes in the United States.

title.children: Player 'with natural kick' switches from Aussie Rules to American football

image.altText: A mother smiling and hugging a young boy in Crows top holding a football next to seats at an oval

props.synopsis: AFL barracking is again in the spotlight after the recent booing of a player who was the victim of a slur. Confronted by some of the language they recently heard at a match, footy fans Angela and Archie came up with a "light way to get around a bit of a serious topic".

title.children: Amid booing, sledges and slurs, AFL fans resort to 'swearing spotto'

image.altText: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou sitting in the parliament benches of the French Assembly.

props.synopsis: The move will heap further pressure on French President Emmanuel Macron, who is now tasked with appointing a successor.

title.children: French PM loses confidence vote as country faces 'life-threatening' debt

image.altText: man in bush hat and pink shirt holds up his 4 year old son in stripped shirt

props.synopsis: In outback NSW, fourth-generation farmer Sam Beven is forging the way for the next generation of farming families.

title.children: Young dad takes over sheep station 'bigger than Singapore' to keep legacy

image.altText: The prime minister in a bright shirt

props.synopsis: A landmark $500 million agreement to "transform" the relationship between Australia and Vanuatu still hangs in the balance as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese flies to the Pacific Island nation.

title.children: Albanese flies to Vanuatu for $500 million signing ceremony that might not happen

image.altText: Julie Inman Grant looking down the barrel of the camera in a portrait.

props.synopsis: Australian children will be prevented from having sexual, violent or harmful conversations with AI companions in a world-first move announced today.

title.children: Chatbots to be banned from talking sex or suicide with Australian kids

image.altText: A man in an  orange vest stands in front of a bus with gunshots through the window.

props.synopsis: Israeli authorities say six people have been killed and 15 wounded by gunmen at a junction on the outskirts of Jerusalem.

title.children: Six killed by gunmen at bus stop in Jerusalem, at least 15 wounded

image.altText: Shark sighted sign at Dee Why Beach after fatal shark attack

props.synopsis: Shark nets were installed last week along the Northern Beaches, including at a nearby beach where a Sydney surfer was killed in an attack.

title.children: Why shark nets don't aways stop the predators

image.altText: A man in a suit looks on.

props.synopsis: Prince Harry returns to London — a rare trip home — and pays tribute to his late grandmother on the third anniversary of her death, but whether he'll meet with the king during his quick visit remains unclear.

title.children: Prince Harry makes rare visit to London, on anniversary of queen's death

image.altText: A man with dark hair and glasses in a suit.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann has lodged legal action in the Federal Court against the Commissioner of the National Anti-Corruption Commission and a federal minister.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann wades into new Federal Court battle

image.altText: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price in the senate

props.synopsis: A senior Liberal rejects Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's accusations that he has engaged in "cowardly and inappropriate behaviour" and publicly calls on the senator to apologise for the "ongoing harm" she is causing with her remarks about Indian migrants.

title.children: Hawke tells Nampijinpa Price to apologise to Indian Australians

image.altText: Two women in army uniform

props.synopsis: Figures released today reveal there has been a slight decrease in the number of deaths by suicides by serving and former Australian Defence Force members.

title.children: Data reveals number of ADF veterans who sought help in year before suicide

image.altText: Hundreds of people gather near a grey building as some people stand atop it damaging it

props.synopsis: Police and protesters have clashed with tear gas, rubber bullets and water cannons deployed by officers as thousands of young people tried to storm the parliament.

title.children: At least 19 people killed in violent protests in Kathmandu

image.altText: People walk in front of an artwork on a wall of a judge beating a protester with a gavel

props.synopsis: The latest mural from the British street artist depicts a judge beating a protester and is being seen as a reaction to the arrest of hundreds of demonstrators supporting banned group Palestine Action.

title.children: New Banksy mural of judge striking protester at London's High Court

image.altText: A can sits by a crumbling wall.

props.synopsis: Images of these frightened cats rescued by concerned citizens have struck a deep chord in cat-obsessed Indonesia.

title.children: Cats belonging to Indonesian politicians are the unexpected symbol of protests

image.altText: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price standing and smiling.

props.synopsis: An Indian society in Darwin has written to Jacinta Nampijinpa Price, calling the NT senator's comments about Indian migration to Australia "racist" and "ill-founded".

title.children: Senator's Indian constituents call for apology over 'offensive' comments

image.altText: A close up photo of a middle aged Caucasian man with blond hair.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors allege Ryan Routh concealed himself with a rifle near the sixth green of Trump International Golf Club in West Palm Beach, intending to shoot Donald Trump during a round of golf in the final weeks of the 2024 campaign.

title.children: Man accused of trying to kill Trump prepares to defend himself at trial

image.altText: British Airways plane on runway.

props.synopsis: The British Airways passenger flight BA16 was on its way to Singapore and made the emergency return to Sydney Airport about an hour after take-off on Monday afternoon.

title.children: BA flight's emergency landing at Sydney Airport was due to false alarm

image.altText: Woman with dark hair smiles with mouth closed

props.synopsis: When Louisa Ioannidis was found dead in a creek, police found no suspicious circumstances. But Louisa's brother had his doubts, and now a legal team has found compelling new evidence that the case should be reopened.

title.children: Dead in her dressing gown, the shocking events before Louisa's creek death

image.altText: Tony Burke and Anthony Albanese in the house of representatives.

props.synopsis: The report from a Senate committee tasked with scrutinising bills was tabled hours after the controversial changes passed parliament.

title.children: Laws boosting deportation powers not sufficiently justified, committee warns

image.altText: Looking through glass into a near-empty Coles supermarket. Checkouts can be seen in front of fruit and vegetables.

props.synopsis: Supermarket giants Coles and Woolworths expect to spend hundreds of millions of dollars more to repay staff the companies underpaid, following a legal judgement experts say could have wide-reaching implications.

title.children: Financial fallout of Woolworths, Coles underpayments could climb past $1 billion

image.altText: A police coffin at a funeral with cap and flowers on top of it

props.synopsis: Lisa Thompson says her final weekend with her boyfriend Neal Thompson before he was killed in a shooting at Porepunkah was their best yet.

title.children: Police officer Neal Thompson farewelled by grieving loved ones

image.altText: A close up of Tom Phillips' face.

props.synopsis: Tom Phillips is killed during a shootout with police during a burglary in New Zealand's Waikato region, his sister says.

title.children: NZ fugitive on the run for four years shot dead during store burglary

image.altText: A man sitting with the ocean behind him has a slight smile in his hand he holds a black rock.

props.synopsis: He has the chic of a Silicon Valley tech bro and a clean energy pitch for investors, but will Gerard Barron's deep-sea mining dream do more harm than good?

title.children: He's been called Australia's Elon Musk. This is his 'trillion-dollar' plan

image.altText: A man with brown hair sings into a mic

props.synopsis: Rick Davies, the co-founder and lead singer for British rock band Supertramp, has died aged 81 after a decade-long battle with cancer.

title.children: Supertramp co-founder Rick Davies dies aged 81

image.altText: Group of people at smoking ceremony

props.synopsis: A guard has admitted to watching a soccer game on TV in the moments leading up to the death of an Indigenous inmate, an inquest has heard in its first day.

title.children: Guard was watching TV in lead up to Indigenous inmate's death, inquest hears

image.altText: Man in blue suit jacket with black Labrador dog

props.synopsis: A vision-impaired Paralympic swimmer says he had to involve police when three different Uber drivers refused him transport because he had his guide dog with him.

title.children: Police called after Uber drivers refused service to Paralympian with guide dog

image.altText: A young man wearing a puffer jacket smiles while holding a red shoe.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old boy killed as he made his way home from playing basketball is being mourned as police investigate the fatal stabbing of two children in Melbourne's outer-west on Saturday night.

title.children: 'Beautiful' young man among pair mourned after fatal Melbourne attacks

image.altText: In a large black dress lady gaga accepts her award and speaks

props.synopsis: Ariana Grande and Lady Gaga took home the biggest awards at this year's MTV VMAs with several nineties stars honoured for their musical legacy.

title.children: Key moments from the 2025 MTV Video Music Awards
